arm_group.description: 110mg caffeine with 108 mg chlorogenic acid at start of study
110 mg caffeine with 235 mg chlorogenic acid at start of the study
110 mg caffeine at start of study

brief_summary.textblock:
Evidence suggests that a diet rich in plant phenolic compounds may induce beneficial
      vascular effects.  Coffee is a good source of phenolic compounds called chlorogenic acids
      (CGA), however the level of CGA is reduced during the roasting process.

      The aim of this study is to investigate the effect of coffee roasting on vascular response.
      The investigators hypothesize that coffee roasted to a lesser extent will exert a favourable
      vascular response over more heavily roasted coffee due to the higher levels of CGA.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of High and Low Roasted Coffee on Vascular Response

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male

          -  A signed consent form

          -  Age 19-35 years

          -  Body mass index - 18.5-30 kg/m2

          -  Normal blood pressure at screening (< 150/90)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Blood pressure > 150/90 mmHg

          -  Haemoglobin (anaemia marker) < 125 g/l

          -  Gamma GT (liver enzymes) > 80 IU/l

          -  Cholesterol > 6.5 mmol/l

          -  Had suffered a myocardial infarction or stroke in the previous 12 months

          -  Suffers from any reproductive disorder

          -  Suffers from any blood-clotting disorder

          -  Suffers from any metabolic disorders (e.g. diabetes or any other endocrine or liver
             diseases)

          -  Any dietary restrictions or on a weight reducing diet

          -  Drinking more than 21 units per week

          -  On any lipid-modifying medication

          -  On any blood pressure lowering medication

          -  On any medication affecting blood clotting

          -  Planning on altering consumption of vitamin supplements/fish oil capsules during the
             course of the study

          -  Regular or vigorous exercise (3 times/week, 20 minutes each session)

          -  Smoking

          -  Vegetarians or vegans

facility.name: Department of Food and Nutritional Sciences

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of High and Low Roasted Coffee on Vascular Response

primary_outcome.measure: Vascular response measured by flow mediated dilatation (FMD)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
